metadata.title: CVE-2018-16646 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In Poppler 0.68.0, the Parser::getObj() function in Parser.cc may causeinfinite recursion via a crafted file. A remote attacker can leverage thisfor a DoS attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.13').
